topics.licences:
Please has a limited ability to detect licences from third-party code.
Accepted / rejected licences can be marked in .plzconfig; no action is taken until something is set there.
topics.plzconfig:
The root of a Please repo is identified by a .plzconfig file. This also has a number of options to control various ways it behaves.

See https://please.build/config.html for a detailed reference of all options.

There are several different .plzconfig files that can be loaded, which override one another. From lowest to highest priority:
 .plzconfig, which identifies the repo root.
 .plzconfig_linux_amd64 (or _darwin_amd64, etc) defines arch-specific options.
 /etc/plzconfig can be used to define machine-specific options (e.g. on a CI server)
 .plzconfig.local is used for non-checked-in config that is bespoke to the user.
